description: English spheric +‎ -al (see sphere), from Latin sphericus (+ -al), from Ancient Greek σφαιρικός (sphairikós).

adjectives.description: spherical (comparative more spherical, superlative most spherical)

entries.meaning: (geometry, not comparable) Of, or pertaining to, spheres.
(mathematics) Of a coordinate system, specifying the location of a point in a plane by using a radius and two angles.
(astrology) Of or relating to the heavenly orbs, or to the sphere or spheres in which, according to ancient astronomy and astrology, they were set.
